explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.findings: The company states a commitment to minimizing bias in AI and building AI that is safe, trustworthy, and ethical. A report describes the integration of DEI thinking and states a commitment to diversity goals.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post discusses Union Pacific's approach to generative AI and machine learning in freight transportation. It provides evidence for **fairness**, **governance**, and **transparency** by stating a commitment to minimizing bias and building AI that is safe, trustworthy, ethical, and transparent. The post also highlights a policy for intellectual property protection when using large language models, acknowledging their "black box" nature and implying a consideration for transparency.
relevant_sources.title: How Generative AI & Machine Learning Help Freight Shipping & Logistics

relevant_sources.summary: The "2022 Building America Report – Autonomous Inspection and Rail Algorithms" provides evidence for **fairness, governance, and transparency**. The report details the integration of DEI thinking and a commitment to diversity goals, supporting **fairness**. It also describes the use of AI tools for decision optimization and safety, along with a risk-based model for rail replacement, indicating **governance** through structured decision-making processes and the assignment of responsibility. Furthermore, the report explains AI systems that simulate physics and make recommendations, as well as deployed AI suites used for real-time decision-making, demonstrating **transparency** in system function and capabilities.
relevant_sources.title: 2022 Building America Report – Autonomous Inspection and Rail Algorithms

governance.findings: The company states a commitment to building safe, trustworthy, and ethical AI, and references a policy for intellectual property protection when using large language models. Reports describe the use of AI tools for decision optimization and safety, along with a risk-based model for rail replacement, describing structured decision-making processes and assigned responsibility. A filing describes the company's commitment to managing AI-related cybersecurity and technology risks through formal risk management processes, testing, and coordination with government agencies, referencing governance over automated systems.

It provides evidence for **fairness**, **governance**, and **transparency** by stating a commitment to minimizing bias and building AI that is safe, trustworthy, ethical, and transparent. The post also highlights a policy for intellectual property protection when using large language models, acknowledging their "black box" nature and implying a consideration for transparency.

relevant_sources.summary: Union Pacific's 2024 Form 10-K filing discusses AI-related cybersecurity and technology risks, providing evidence for the **governance** pillar. The document highlights the company's commitment to managing these evolving risks through formal risk management processes, testing, and coordination with government agencies, indicating a governance framework for AI-driven threats and broader cybersecurity. This filing also implies governance over automated systems by describing technology for automation and risk mitigation, supported by an operational command center for intervention.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Form 10-K – AI-Related Cybersecurity and Technology Risk

oversight.findings: The company describes semi-autonomous crane operation where a remote human operator handles the final lowering step. This describes human oversight of automated systems.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post on "Autonomous AI-Integrated Intermodal Cranes" provides evidence for the **oversight** and **transparency** pillars. The post describes semi-autonomous crane operation where a remote human operator handles the final lowering step, demonstrating human oversight of automated systems. The mention of AI integration and semi-autonomous operation also supports the transparency pillar by indicating the deployment of AI capabilities within the system.
relevant_sources.title: Autonomous AI-Integrated Intermodal Cranes

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: The company states a commitment to building transparent AI and references a policy for intellectual property protection when using large language models. Published materials describe the capabilities and functions of AI systems, including SmartETA for shipment ETAs, AI/ML for derailment prevention, and AI suites for real-time decision-making. The company also references providing customers with access to AI and data visualization capabilities built on their shipment trace data.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post discusses Union Pacific's approach to generative AI and machine learning in freight transportation. It provides evidence for **fairness**, **governance**, and **transparency** by stating a commitment to minimizing bias and building AI that is safe, trustworthy, ethical, and transparent. The post also highlights a policy for intellectual property protection when using large language models, acknowledging their "black box" nature and implying a consideration for transparency.
relevant_sources.title: How Generative AI & Machine Learning Help Freight Shipping & Logistics

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "SmartETA Machine Learning for Shipment ETAs," provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar. It describes how the SmartETA system uses machine learning and predictive analytics to generate estimated times of arrival by analyzing GPS signals, velocity information, and operational data. The post also highlights the system's ability to provide proactive customer notifications and integrate with customer systems via APIs, offering insight into the system's capabilities and how it functions.
relevant_sources.title: SmartETA Machine Learning for Shipment ETAs

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "AI and Machine Learning for Derailment Prevention," provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar of responsible AI. The article details how Union Pacific uses AI and ML to process vast amounts of data from wayside detectors and machine vision cameras to predict equipment failures, demonstrating transparency in the system's capabilities and its application in predictive maintenance and safety use cases.
relevant_sources.title: AI and Machine Learning for Derailment Prevention

It also describes the use of AI tools for decision optimization and safety, along with a risk-based model for rail replacement, indicating **governance** through structured decision-making processes and the assignment of responsibility. relevant_sources.summary: This blog post about the "Hack! 2023 AI-Enabled Customer Trace Platform Concept" provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar. The concept explicitly mentions providing customers with access to AI and data visualization capabilities built on their shipment trace data, indicating transparency about the intended use of AI.
relevant_sources.title: Hack! 2023 AI-Enabled Customer Trace Platform Concept

summary.overall_findings: Union Pacific's published materials address responsible AI practices at both operational and policy levels. These disclosures address 4 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, including operational practices such as human oversight of automated systems through remote human operators in semi-autonomous crane operations. Fairness is documented at the policy level through a commitment to minimizing bias in AI, while transparency and governance also feature operational details like a referenced policy for intellectual property protection when using large language models, drawing from 11 publicly available sources. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability, privacy, and 1 additional pillar.
